channel.title: Global Agriculture & Commodities Monitor
channel.description: Real-time tracking of global crop forecasts, trade policy, weather, and ag-tech innovation.

item.title: US Farm Leaders Warn Congress of 'Widespread Collapse'
item.description: A coalition of 27 former USDA officials and commodity heads sent an urgent letter to Congress warning that high input costs and lost export markets risk a "widespread collapse" of the US farm economy in 2026.

item.title: FAO Food Price Index Drops 0.5% in January
item.description: The FAO Food Price Index averaged 123.9 points in January 2026, down 0.5 points. Lower prices for meat, sugar, and dairy offset slight increases in cereals and vegetable oils.

item.title: India: Heatwave Threatens Wheat Yields in Punjab
item.description: India's key winter-wheat belts face a hotter, drier February. The heat stress during the grain-filling stage risks lowering yields by 10-15% despite record planted acreage.

item.title: South Africa: 367 Cattle Impounded in Grazing Crackdown
item.description: A joint military and police operation in the Eastern Cape impounded 367 cattle (worth R3.67m) for illegal grazing in protected zones, signaling a stricter enforcement policy on biosecurity.

item.title: CN Rail Reports Near-Record January Grain Movement
item.description: Canadian National Railway (CN) moved 2.72 million metric tonnes of Western Canadian grain in January 2026, its second-best January performance on record.

item.title: Rice Prices Jump 1.8% on Strong Global Demand
item.description: The FAO All Rice Price Index rose 1.8% in January, driven by "firmer demand" for fragrant varieties and tightening export supplies in Vietnam and Thailand.

item.title: World Bank Forecasts 7% Drop in Beverage Prices
item.description: The World Bank predicts a 7% decline in coffee and cocoa prices for 2026 as production in Brazil and West Africa rebounds from 2025 lows.

item.title: Brazil Ag Outlook: Record Soy Harvest vs. Margin Squeeze
item.description: Rabobank projects Brazil's 2026 soy harvest will hit a record 177 million MT, but high input costs are triggering a rise in bankruptcy filings among Mato Grosso farmers.

item.title: Agility Index: 98% of Ag-Logistics Firms Use AI
item.description: The 2026 Agility Emerging Markets Index reveals that 98% of cold-chain operators have integrated AI to manage volatility in perishable goods trade.

item.title: California: Atmospheric River Boosts Reservoir Levels
item.description: A late-season atmospheric river has boosted California's reservoir aggregate storage to 115% of the historical average, securing water allocations for Central Valley growers.

item.title: Kenya Tea Exports Hit Record High in January
item.description: Kenya's tea exports surged 12% year-over-year in January 2026, benefiting from lower output in Sri Lanka and improved port efficiency at Mombasa.

item.title: John Deere Launches Autonomous Cotton Picker
item.description: John Deere has unveiled the CP770-A, a fully autonomous cotton picker scheduled for limited commercial release in the US South for the 2026 harvest.

item.title: EU Report: €158B Livestock Assets at Risk of Stranding
item.description: A new EU Commission report warns that €158 billion in animal agriculture investments could become "stranded assets" as policy shifts toward plant-based proteins.

item.title: Reefer Rejection Rates Spike to 20% on US Ice Storms
item.description: Severe ice storms in the US Midwest caused refrigerated truck rejection rates to spike to 20%, disrupting the movement of perishable foods and pharmaceuticals.

item.title: Global Food Systems Get AI-First Transformation Thrust
item.description: Major food conglomerates (Nestlé, Danone) announced a joint $1B investment fund to accelerate "AI-First" regenerative supply chains.

item.title: Vietnam Coffee Growers Hold Back Stock
item.description: Vietnamese Robusta farmers are withholding 30% of their harvest, betting on higher prices as dry weather forecasts persist for the Central Highlands.

item.title: China Approves 3 New GM Maize Varieties
item.description: China's Ministry of Agriculture has approved three new domestic GM maize varieties for nationwide planting, aiming to reduce feed import dependence.

item.title: Ukraine Grain Exports Reach Pre-War Levels for Jan
item.description: Despite ongoing conflict, Ukraine exported 5.1 million tonnes of grain in January 2026, utilizing the expanded Danube corridor and Romanian rail links.

item.title: Argentina: Insect Plague Threatens Late Corn
item.description: The Rosario Grains Exchange warns that a leafhopper outbreak is threatening 15% of Argentina's late-planted corn crop, potentially cutting production by 3M tonnes.

item.title: China-Canada Deal: Canola Tariffs Slashed to 15%
item.description: China has agreed to lower tariffs on Canadian canola seed from 84% to 15% and lift bans on Canadian beef, aiming to boost imports.

item.title: US Supreme Court Hears IEEPA Tariff Case
item.description: The Supreme Court began hearing arguments on the executive use of IEEPA for broad tariffs, a case with massive implications for agricultural input costs.

item.title: LMI Index Drops to 54.2, Signaling Capacity Crunch
item.description: The Logistics Manager’s Index (LMI) dropped to 54.2 for January, indicating tightening transport capacity for bulk agricultural goods.

item.title: France: Farmers Blockade Paris over 'Green Deal' 2.0
item.description: French farmers have blockaded major highways around Paris with 500 tractors, protesting the implementation of the EU's stricter "Green Deal 2.0" pesticide rules.

item.title: Dairy Prices Soften at Global Dairy Trade Auction
item.description: The GDT Price Index fell 1.2% in the second January auction, led by a 3% drop in Whole Milk Powder (WMP) prices due to weak Chinese demand.

item.title: US-China Trade Truce Signed Until Nov 2026
item.description: The US and China have agreed to a trade "Truce", pausing new export controls and tariff escalations until November 2026, stabilizing soybean flows.

item.title: World Bank: Global Ag Prices to Dip 2% in 2026
item.description: The World Bank projects a 2% decline in global agricultural prices for 2026 as supply outpaces demand, though "geopolitical distance" now distorts 25% of trade flows.

item.title: Major Infrastructure Projects Set to Reshape Trade Routes
item.description: The "Capricorn Bioceanic Corridor" in South America is set for late 2026 completion, promising to cut freight costs for Brazilian ag exports to Asia by 40%.

item.title: EU and India Sign Historic Free Trade Agreement
item.description: The EU and India officially signed an FTA eliminating tariffs on 96% of goods. The deal protects EU dairy but opens the Indian market to European wines and spirits.

item.title: US Imposes 25% Tariff on Iran-Linked Supply Chains
item.description: New US sanctions impose a 25% tariff on entities trading with Iran, creating potential complications for rice and tea traders in the Middle East.

item.title: UPS Cuts 30,000 Jobs, Impacting Rural Delivery
item.description: UPS announced cuts of 30,000 positions and the closure of 24 facilities. Rural farm part deliveries are expected to see increased lead times.

item.title: WTO Slashes 2026 Trade Forecast to 0.5%
item.description: The WTO cut its 2026 merchandise trade growth forecast to 0.5% due to rising protectionism, signaling a slow year for global bulk commodity movement.

item.title: Nigeria: Fertilizer Prices Rise 15% on FX Shortage
item.description: Nigerian farmers face a 15% hike in fertilizer prices as foreign exchange shortages hamper the import of potash and phosphates ahead of planting.

item.title: Efficiency, Not Yield, Emerges as AgTech's Next ROI
item.description: A new industry report argues that 2026 AgTech adoption is driven by cost-efficiency (labor/input reduction) rather than pure yield maximization.

item.title: Australia: Cyclone Kirrily Damages Banana Crops
item.description: Cyclone Kirrily has caused significant damage to banana plantations in North Queensland, with early estimates suggesting a 20% loss of the region's crop.

item.title: Georgia Corn Acres to Surge 46% in 2026
item.description: University of Georgia forecasts a 46.7% increase in state corn planting for 2026, driven by rotation needs and local poultry feed demand.

item.title: Mexico: Bean Farmers Protest Low Prices
item.description: Farmers in Zacatecas are threatening road blockades as bean prices crash. Government purchase programs are covering only a fraction of the harvest.

item.title: Analytic Trends: Proactive Ag-Data for 2026
item.description: Data analytics in agriculture are shifting from "reactive" to "proactive," with new platforms forecasting equipment failures and pest outbreaks weeks in advance.

item.title: South Africa Issues First 'Regenerative' Carbon Credits
item.description: The GRASS project in South Africa has issued 266,000 CCB-labelled carbon credits via communal regenerative grazing, a first for the continent.

item.title: US Cancels Retaliatory Tariffs on European Goods
item.description: The US administration formally cancelled proposed 10% retaliatory tariffs against 8 European nations, sparing French wine and Italian cheese imports.

item.title: Foot-and-Mouth Disease Threatens SA Exports
item.description: Farming bodies in South Africa warn of a crisis as Foot-and-Mouth Disease (FMD) spreads in KwaZulu-Natal, causing China to suspend wool imports.

item.title: Canada Outlook: Wheat Acres Down, Pulses Up
item.description: Agriculture Canada's first 2026 outlook sees wheat area declining 0.3%, while pulse exports are forecast to rise 18% to 5.75Mt on strong Indian demand.

item.title: Nigeria Launches SHEP Agribusiness Training
item.description: Nigeria's Ministry of Agriculture rolled out the SHEP program to transition 50,000 subsistence farmers to commercial market-oriented horticulture.

item.title: Trucking Spot Rates Rise to $2.46/Mile
item.description: US dry van spot rates rose 9.1% to $2.46 per mile in January, increasing transport costs for domestic grain and feed movements.

item.title: Indonesia Sets 2029 Garlic Self-Sufficiency Goal
item.description: Indonesia, currently importing 95% of its garlic, has launched a seed distribution campaign in Central Java to achieve self-sufficiency by 2029.

item.title: Intra-Asia Ag Freight Rates Drop 6%
item.description: Freight rates for intra-Asia agricultural trade dropped 6% as processing hubs in Vietnam and Thailand paused orders ahead of the Lunar New Year.

item.title: US Section 232 Tariffs on Critical Minerals
item.description: New US tariffs on critical minerals are expected to increase the cost of producing advanced batteries for electric farm machinery.

item.title: Generative Design Cuts Ag-Machinery Dev Cycles
item.description: Autodesk reports that agricultural manufacturers using AI-driven generative design have reduced new tractor development cycles by 50%.

item.title: West Coast Port Volumes Jump 20% Pre-LNY
item.description: US West Coast port volumes surged 20% above normal as agricultural exporters rushed soybeans and chilled pork before the Asian holiday shutdown.

item.title: Forest Farming Gains Traction in Appalachia
item.description: USDA grants are fueling a boom in "forest farming" for ginseng and mushrooms in Appalachia, offering smallholders a high-value alternative crop.

item.title: AgTech Trend: 'De-Chemicalization' to Define 2026
item.description: Investment reports identify "De-Chemicalization" as a top trend, with biological inputs expected to capture 12% of the global crop protection market by year-end.

item.title: US Policy Outlook: Farm Bill Still Delayed
item.description: Congress enters 2026 without a new Farm Bill. The House Ag Committee plans to release a new draft in late February, but partisan gridlock remains high.

item.title: Canada-China Canola Deal Reached
item.description: An Agreement-in-Principle will see China reduce tariffs on Canadian canola seed from 85% to 15%, ending a 2-year trade dispute.

item.title: Air Cargo Demand Rises 5.5% on Flower Exports
item.description: IATA reports a 5.5% increase in air cargo demand, driven by a surge in cut flower exports from Kenya and Colombia ahead of Valentine's Day.

item.title: Amazon Cuts 'Fresh' Logistics Roles
item.description: Amazon's 5% cut to middle-mile management is expected to impact its "Amazon Fresh" grocery distribution network.

item.title: UNCTAD: Global GDP Growth Stagnant at 2.6%
item.description: UNCTAD projects global growth will remain at 2.6% for 2026, warning that a "liquidity crunch" in developing nations will hamper food imports.

item.title: Egypt Tenders for 500k Tonnes of Wheat
item.description: GASC, Egypt's state grain buyer, has issued an international tender for 500,000 tonnes of milling wheat, with Russian and French origins expected to compete.

item.title: Brazil: Mato Grosso Harvest Progresses Slowly
item.description: Soybean harvest in Mato Grosso is 4% complete, lagging the 5-year average of 9% due to persistent rains making fields inaccessible.

item.title: India: Onion Export Ban Extended Indefinitely
item.description: The Indian government has extended the ban on onion exports indefinitely to control domestic inflation, impacting markets in Bangladesh and Nepal.

item.title: Clean Meat Startups Face Funding 'Winter'
item.description: Venture capital funding for cultivated meat startups dropped 40% in Q4 2025, leading to consolidation rumors for major players in the sector.

item.title: Port of Saint John Completes C$247M Upgrade
item.description: The Port of Saint John (Canada) completed its modernization, quadrupling capacity. This is critical for potash fertilizer exports and Atlantic seafood trade.

item.title: World Bank: 25% of Trade Now Driven by Geopolitics
item.description: A new report states that "geopolitical distance" now dictates 25% of global trade flows, leading to inefficient food routing and higher costs for importers.

item.title: Winter Sowing Tips for Colder Climates
item.description: Extension services recommend winter sowing for hardy vegetables like spinach and kale to get a head start on the spring market in northern zones.

item.title: FedEx Expands Drone Delivery to Rural Pharmacies
item.description: FedEx has expanded its autonomous drone delivery pilot to serve rural pharmacies in three new US states, improving access for isolated farm communities.

item.title: New Zealand: Milk Production Up 2% in December
item.description: New Zealand milk production rose 2% year-over-year in December, benefiting from favorable pasture growth conditions on the North Island.

item.title: Factory Construction Boom Forecast for 2026
item.description: A surge in food processing factory groundbreakings is expected in 2026, driven by the localization of supply chains for value-added products.

item.title: BDO: 3D Printing Parts Critical for Farm Repair
item.description: BDO predicts that on-farm 3D printing of metal parts will become a "survival requirement" for remote farms to reduce equipment downtime.

item.title: UN Warns of 'Global Water Bankruptcy' ($307B Cost)
item.description: The UN estimates that water scarcity could cost the global economy $307 billion annually, with irrigated agriculture facing the steepest risks.

item.title: Maersk Announces Blank Sailings for Lunar New Year
item.description: Maersk scheduled seven blank sailings on Transpacific routes, reducing capacity for US agricultural exports to Asia during February.

item.title: La Niña Persists, Transition Expected in Spring
item.description: NOAA confirms La Niña conditions persist in the Pacific, with a 75% chance of transitioning to neutral by March-May 2026.

item.title: Germany: Organic Food Sales Stagnate
item.description: German organic food sales remained flat in 2025 as inflation-weary consumers traded down to conventional produce, pressuring organic premiums.

item.title: Philippines Imports 450k Tonnes of Rice
item.description: Private traders in the Philippines booked 450,000 tonnes of rice imports in early January to buffer against potential El Niño impacts later in the year.

item.title: US Ethanol Production Hits 4-Year High
item.description: US ethanol production averaged 1.1 million barrels per day in the first week of January, the highest level since 2022, supporting corn basis.

item.title: Australia: Wheat Harvest Wrap-Up Shows Quality
item.description: As the Australian wheat harvest concludes, protein levels are averaging higher than expected (11.5%), attracting buyers from the Middle East.

item.title: Brazil: Heavy Rains Aid Soy, Delay Harvest
item.description: Widespread heavy rains across Brazil have improved soil moisture for the record-breaking soy crop but are now delaying harvest machinery access.

item.title: Cyberattacks Hit 1 in 5 Food Manufacturers
item.description: RSM reports that 18% of middle-market manufacturers, including food processors, suffered data breaches in 2025, highlighting digital risks.

item.title: Argentina: Rain Stabilizes Corn Pollination
item.description: Timely precipitation in Northern Argentina has created favorable conditions for corn pollination, stabilizing yield estimates after a dry start.

item.title: New Superfood 'Chlorella' Gains Traction
item.description: Freshwater algae Chlorella vulgaris is gaining traction as a sustainable protein source in Japan and Germany, with new farms opening in 2026.

item.title: Global Manufacturing Tariffs Rise to 6.7%
item.description: The average global tariff on manufactured goods (including farm machinery) rose to 6.7% in Jan 2026, raising capital costs for farmers.

item.title: Ukraine: Winter Wheat Conditions Rated 'Good'
item.description: Ukraine's Ministry of Ag reports that 80% of winter wheat crops are in good condition thanks to mild weather and adequate snow cover.

item.title: Mexico Hikes Tariffs on Asian Imports
item.description: Mexico has increased tariffs by 10-50% on over 1,400 products from non-FTA countries, affecting fertilizer and agro-chemical inputs.

item.title: Canada's Forced Labour Reporting Law Live
item.description: New regulations now require all large Canadian importers to report on measures taken to prevent forced labor, impacting coffee and cocoa chains.

item.title: Central US Sees 'Significant Warming' Trend
item.description: Unseasonal warming in the Central US has reduced protective snow cover for winter wheat, leaving the crop vulnerable to sudden freeze events.

item.title: AgTech Funding Forecast to Hit $30B
item.description: Venture capital projections estimate global AgTech funding will reach $30 billion in 2026, with a focus on climate-smart solutions and autonomy.

item.title: Chile Cherry Exports Set New Record
item.description: Chile exported a record 85 million boxes of cherries in the 2025/26 season, with 90% destined for China for the Lunar New Year.

item.title: Morocco: Drought Cuts Cereal Planting by 15%
item.description: Persistent drought in Morocco has forced farmers to reduce cereal planting area by 15%, increasing the nation's import needs for 2026.

item.title: Poland: Farmers Protest Grain Imports
item.description: Polish farmers have resumed protests at the Medyka border crossing, demanding tighter quality controls on incoming grain shipments.

item.title: Japan: Butter Shortage Looms for Spring
item.description: Japan's Agriculture Ministry plans to import 10,000 tonnes of butter as domestic milk output falls faster than consumption.

item.title: California: Almond Acreage Drops 3%
item.description: California almond bearing acreage dropped 3% in 2025 as growers removed older orchards due to water costs and lower prices.

item.title: Ivory Coast: Cocoa Arrivals Down 15%
item.description: Cocoa arrivals at ports in Ivory Coast are down 15% year-over-year, supporting high global cocoa futures prices.

item.title: Thailand: Sugar Production to Drop 10%
item.description: Thailand's Office of Cane and Sugar Board forecasts a 10% drop in sugar output due to cassava switching and dry weather.

item.title: John Deere stock rises on autonomous news
item.description: Shares of Deere & Co rose 2% after announcements of its new autonomous cotton picker and strong pre-orders for 2026.

item.title: US Cattles Inventory Hits 60-Year Low
item.description: The USDA reports that the US cattle herd has shrunk to its lowest level in 60 years, underpinning record high beef prices.

item.title: Spain: Olive Oil Production Rebounds
item.description: Spain's olive oil production is estimated to reach 1.2 million tonnes, a significant recovery from the drought-stricken previous harvest.

item.title: Turkey: Hazelnut Exports Up 10%
item.description: Turkish hazelnut exports rose 10% in volume during the first 4 months of the season, driven by strong demand from EU confectioners.

item.title: Colombia: Coffee Output Stabilizes
item.description: Colombian coffee production stabilized at 11.5 million bags in 2025, ending a two-year decline caused by La Niña rains.

item.title: Pakistan: Rice Exports to Reach record 5M Tonnes
item.description: Pakistan is on track to export a record 5 million tonnes of rice in FY26, filling the void left by India's export ban.

item.title: Cargill to Open New Protein Plant in Thailand
item.description: Cargill has announced a $70M investment to expand its poultry processing capacity in Thailand to serve export markets in Japan.

item.title: France: Wine Production Lowest in 5 Years
item.description: France's 2025 wine harvest was confirmed as the lowest in 5 years due to mildew and heatwaves, driving up bulk wine prices.

item.title: Tractor Sales Slump 5% in North America
item.description: Sales of high-horsepower tractors in the US and Canada fell 5% in late 2025 as farmers deferred capital due to lower grain prices.

item.title: Peru: Blueberry Exports Overtake Copper in Growth
item.description: Peru's blueberry exports grew 25% in value in 2025, becoming one of the country's fastest-growing non-traditional export sectors.

item.title: Russia: Grain Export Quota Set at 24M Tonnes
item.description: Russia has set its grain export quota for the second half of the season (Feb-June 2026) at 24 million tonnes to secure domestic supply.

item.title: Vertical Farming Unicorn 'Infarm' Declares Insolvency
item.description: Another major vertical farming startup has filed for insolvency, citing high energy costs and inability to compete with outdoor produce prices.

item.title: UK: Post-Brexit Border Checks Delay Meat Imports
item.description: New physical border checks on EU meat imports to the UK have caused delays of up to 24 hours, raising costs for retailers.
